Operation 'get-category-rated-areas' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context, poor_ai_interpretability. The original summary is overly generic and uses HTTP method terminology rather than action-oriented language. The description is completely empty, providing no context about the operation's purpose, inputs, outputs, or use case. This severely impacts AI agent interpretability. The improved summary uses action-oriented language ('Retrieve') and clarifies what is being retrieved. The description explains the operation's purpose within the Location Score API domain, specifies expected inputs and outputs, provides context about category ratings, and helps AI agents understand when to use this operation for location quality assessment.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve category-rated areas for a location
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves category-rated areas and their scores for a specified location. This operation returns detailed ratings across multiple categories (such as safety, culture, dining, etc.) for a given geographic area, enabling location quality assessment. Requires location parameters (latitude/longitude or location ID). Returns an array of category ratings with individual scores and metadata. Use this to evaluate location desirability across different lifestyle categories.
